intro: Phacelia commixta, commonly known as the mixed phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows and disturbed soils, and it has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Phacelia commixta is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies due to its nectar-rich blossoms.
